intro: Cullumia cirsioides, commonly known as roughleaf cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Cullumia cirsioides is often found in chaparral and desert scrub habitats.
